meanings.definition: To enter a building illegally and commit theft.
meanings.sent1: Last night, someone burgled the store down the street.
meanings.sent2: The thief burgled the house while the owners were on vacation.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon burgled the picnic basket when nobody was looking.
meanings.sent4: The idea of time burgling away our youth is a common theme in literature.
meanings.sent5: The image of a masked burglar sneaking into a dark house is quite unsettling.

meanings.definition: To steal from a building by breaking in.
meanings.sent1: The burglars burgled the jewelry store and got away with valuable diamonds.
meanings.sent2: Unfortunately, someone burgled our neighbor's garage last week.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat burgled the treat jar from the top shelf.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to burgle the warmth from the cozy cabin.
meanings.sent5: The thought of someone burgling our home while we sleep is terrifying.
